|Title=Knowing the epidemiology of heart failure
|Description=To understand the epidemiology of heart failure in the context of an ageing population and improved treatment of cardiovascular pathologies,
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Olivier Huttin
|Order=1}}

* Prevalence of 1 and 2%.
* Average age: 70-80
* Predominantly male
* High mortality (10% at one year)
* 50% of IC patients have preserved EF and have co-morbidities associated with cardiovascular ageing:
** Renal failure
** Metabolic syndrome - Type 2 diabetes - Obesity
** Pulmonary pathology - Sleep apnoea syndrome
** Anemia
* The ageing of the population and better management of cardiovascular risk factors and coronary events are leading to a growing increase in the prevalence of cardiovascular disease.

properties.question: What are the common comorbidities associated with cardiovascular ageing in adult heart failure patients?
properties.option_a: Renal failure, Type 1 diabetes, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
properties.option_b: Renal failure, Metabolic syndrome, Obesity, Sleep apnoea syndrome, Anemia
properties.option_c: Heart infections, Obesity, Hypertension, Type 2 diabetes, Asthma
properties.option_d: Renal failure, Metabolic syndrome, Obesity, Lung cancer, Hemophilia
